text: Peter Stuart Isaacson, AM, DFC, AFC, DFM (31 July 1920 â€“ 7 April 2017) was an Australian publisher and decorated military pilot. Isaacson was owner of Peter Isaacson Publications, the publisher of various trade publications and suburban newspapers including the Southern Cross and the Sunday Observer in Melbourne. During World War II, he served in the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) as a pilot with RAF Bomber Command and was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross, the Air Force Cross and the Distinguished Flying Medal. Issaacson died on 7 April 2017 at the age of 96, following a short illness in Melbourne, Australia.
